summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting the voluntary interview of a Federal Bureau of Prisons Senior Officer Specialist (SOS) regarding the events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The SOS discusses staffing issues, count procedures, and states he was not informed that Epstein required a new cellmate after his previous cellmate was released.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. The interview focuses on the circumstances leading up to his death in custody.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was released from custody on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death.

persons.name: Roberto
persons.context: A fellow SOS who may have informed the interviewee that Reyes left the SHU. The interviewee clarifies Roberto did not tell him Reyes was released or that Epstein needed a new cellmate.

persons.name: Captain
persons.role: BOP Captain at MCC New York
persons.context: MCC New York leadership with whom staff shared concerns about staffing shortages and operational difficulties. The interviewee states he was not present at meetings where concerns were presented to the Captain.

persons.name: Lieutenant Rice
persons.role: BOP Lieutenant at MCC New York
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the individuals who did not inform the interviewee that Epstein required a new cellmate.

persons.name: Kevin Vincent
persons.context: Signed the OIG Warnings and Assurances form attached to the memorandum. His role appears to be administrative/verification.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) prior to being released on August 9, 2019.
The SOS was assigned to the SHU and had minimal interaction with Epstein, such as escorting him once.
Both are BOP Senior Officer Specialists. Roberto may have provided some information about inmate movement.
The SOS is subordinate to the Captain and stated staff shared operational concerns with the Captain.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day in Custody
events.description: The day before Epstein's death. The interviewee worked overtime and his regular shift, noting Epstein was in the attorney conference room all day and his cellmate Efrain Reyes was released.

events.title: Epstein's Initial Suicide Attempt
events.description: Epstein was placed on suicide watch following an initial attempt. The interviewee learned of this upon returning from military orders.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP SOS
events.description: The date of the voluntary interview documented in this memorandum, conducted by OIG and AUSA personnel.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
United States Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The BOP Senior Officer Specialist interviewed stated he was not informed that Jeffrey Epstein required a new cellmate after Efrain Reyes was released on August 9, 2019, contradicting potential claims by others.

The interviewee described staffing levels at MCC New York as 'abysmal' and stated it was often impossible to perform mandated 30-minute inmate checks due to inmate movement (showers, recreation) and low staff.
The interviewee admitted that 30-minute check logs were sometimes filled out after the fact or even without performing the checks, a practice he disagreed with.
Epstein was in the attorney conference room for the entire duration of the interviewee's shift on August 9, 2019, and never returned to the SHU during that time.
The interviewee was on frequent military orders, including for approximately half of his three-month SHU rotation, which may have impacted his continuity and awareness of specific inmate protocols.
